comments:
The following error was displayed when running 'RAStart.sh' on AIX. Please assign it to Samson Wai. Thanks,

# ./RAStart.sh
Starting Agent Controller
JVMCI200 - ERROR: User register saving is not enabled, Garbage Collection could be incorrect.
JVMCI200 - ERROR: because of this the JVM library is explicitly aborting the process
JVMCI200 - ERROR: You must either rebuild the executable using "-bM:UR"
JVMCI200 - ERROR: or run with "export LDR_CNTRL=USERREGS"


So, I ran "LDR_CNTRL=USERREGS ./setup.bin" but still get the following error. Would you take a look at the problem?


# ./RAStart.sh
Starting Agent Controller
RAServer started successfully
root at boss3 - /opt/IBM/AgentController/bin [!]
# Exception in thread "Thread-11" java.net.BindException: The socket name is already in use.
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketBind(Native Method)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:362)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:341)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:208)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.<init>(ServerSocket.java:164)
        at javax.net.ssl.SSLServerSocket.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.ibm.jsse.bu.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at com.ibm.jsse.JSSEServerSocketFactory.createServerSocket(Unknown Source)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.security.SecureServer.init(SecureServer.java:97)

The first problem is a JDK requirement. It is the IBM JDK which requires the environment variable.

The second problem might be caused by the RAC port(s) being used. Please check port 10002, 10003, 10005 and make sure they are not being used before starting up the RAC.
Furthermore, the Java stack might indicate a left-over java process still hanging around blocking port 10005. Please check if there is any left-over java process in the system.
Joseph, adding you to the cc: list.

After following Samson's suggestion, the problem is gone. Please close this bug.

Copying from Samson's note: 
I suspect that you are calling RAStart.sh and RAStop.sh back-to-back very quickly. Can you try giving it about 10-20 second delay between the scripts?

traces.message: The socket name is already in use.
